title: Has Elegant Grotesque been digitised?
content:
Kia ora folks,

I was just wondering whether Stempel's <cite>Elegant Grotesque</cite> has ever been digitised. (Apparently, Stephenson Blake's <cite>Guildford Sans</cite> is identical).

—K

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141129000908im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Elegant_6208.jpg)
author: kris

comments.content: Don't think so. But maybe H&FJ's Verlag culd give off a similar sort of feeling?

Funny, it sort of looks like Emigre's Base!

hhp

"Funny, it sort of looks like Emigre’s Base!"

Yeah, but better.

—K

Here the originals "normal" and "halbfett" of  
Elegant Grotesk  
D. Stempel AG, Frankfurt am Main  
Erstguß 1928  
Gustav Möhring

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141129000908im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_3672.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141129000908im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_5370.jpg)

Georg
